Direct message the job poster from Atomo, Inc
Kelly D Myers
Entrepreneur ♦ CEO ♦ CTO ♦ Healthcare Predictive Modeling
Are you a talented data scientist that wants to work on problems that make the world a better place? Are you sick of job descriptions that have that same opening line but fail to deliver? We are too. At Atomo, however, we follow through. We use machine learning to identify patients who have undiagnosed diseases so they can be identified, diagnosed and treated promptly. Atomo is addressing the problem of undiagnosed disease head-on. We have developed a series of machine learning technologies that are trained on historical healthcare encounter data and learn to identify patients with certain medical conditions well before they are actually diagnosed. Not only is our solution highly marketable to multiple healthcare constituencies, but it also leads to patients getting the right diagnoses sooner and their physicians getting them the right treatment. Win-Win-Win. Our work has been published in leading medical journals and we have recently been awarded a US Federal Grant from NIH to find undiagnosed patients in another medical condition.Our team is small but experienced and dedicated. Amongst us are two PhDs (one from MIT and the other from UCLA), as well as veterans from the pharmaceutical industry and Healthcare IT Entrepreneurship. We count some of the biggest pharmaceutical companies in the world as customers as well as research and advocacy organizations. Additionally, we collaborate with several academic researchers out of Stanford, University of Pennsylvania, Geisinger Health System, and Ohio State. Atomo is profitable and continues to show steady revenue growth.We are looking for our next team member. This is a full-time position, but for the right candidate, other arrangements are possible. This person is smart, passionate, and an excellent data scientist. They will help us improve our existing algorithms and innovate new solutions to new problems. And membership has its privileges. We have yet to take any outside funding, so in addition to a competitive salary our equity package will be more attractive than other small tech companies. If you think this next team member is you, then we want to hear from you. ResponsibilitiesApply data science and machine learning to healthcare encounter data as well as build upon and improve existing solutions.Work with our healthcare customers to incorporate domain-knowledge about the treatment of different diseases into our solutions.Work with our data engineering team on how to improve implementation of our technologyDevelop new solutions and implement them into production.RequirementsMasters or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or a related quantitative fieldExperience with biostatistics will be an asset.Deep knowledge of machine learning and how to apply it to a wide range of problems.A proven track record of solving problems using machine learning in industry (i.e. beyond class projects), as well as implementing these solutions.Experience in dealing with large-scale datasets.Proficiency in data analysis and other tools such as Python, R, and Unix/Linux.Familiarity with medical claims or EHR data is a plus.
